intro: Struthanthus eichleri, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually reduced to small scales, and it produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. Struthanthus eichleri is a perennial herb that blooms during the spring and early summer months.
